728553f-b.text:
(1)
Bay Street, south from Vanderbilt Avenue. On the east side of the street (left) are the railroad shops of the Staten Island Railroad and fill for the
railroad crossing elimination.
June 7, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A rear view of the railroad yards, seen from the
shore of the Upper Bay.
May 1, 1931
P. L. Sperr

728557f-a.text:
Bay Street (left), west side, at Vanderbilt Avenue. The view is south across part of the new site of the United States Marine Hospital towards Vanderbilt Avenue. On this portion of the site was later erected the new
nurses' home.
June 7, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Across the hospital site towards Vanderbilt Avenue, showing the area situated between Errington and Talbot Places.
June 7, 1931
P. L. Sperr

(3)
South across the hospital site towards Vanderbilt Avenue, between Talbot Place (left) and Tompkins Avenue. The area shown in these views was part of the Vanderbilt estate.
June 13, 1931
P. L. Sperr

728558f-a.text:
Bay Street, west side, at Vanderbilt Avenue. The view is south across part of the new site of the United States Marine Hospital,formerly the Vanderbilt estate. This is the western portion of the hospital site and is nearer Tompkins Avenue.
June 7, 1931
L. Sperr
(2)
Another view in the same direction. Vanderbilt Avenue runs across the face of the view from right to left, directly
in front of the houses.
June 13, 1931
P. L. Sperr
3)
The hospital site near Vanderbilt Avenue and Talbot Place. The house in the center is No. 100 Vanderbilt Avenue at the
corner of Talbot Place.
June 13, 1931
P. L. Sperr

728559f-b.text:
(1) Bay Street, west side, at Vanderbilt Avenue. Shown is a view, in a southwesterly direction, across part of the new United States Marine Hospital site and Tompkins Avenue (telegraph poles thereon). This is the western extremity
of the hospital site.
June 13, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The rear of the old nurses' home of the U. S. Marine Hospital, seen from the Tompkins Avenue portion of the new
site.
June 13, 1931
P. L. Sperr

728562f-b.text:
(1) Bay Street (left), north from Vanderbilt Avenue, showing, between the east side of the avenue and the Upper Bay, the tracks of the Staten Island Railroad and the beginning of operations on grade crossing elimination. The view is from the end of the station platform.
May. 1,1331
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Viewing north across the station platform. On the left are shown buildings of the United States Marine
Hospital.
May 1, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(3)
A pile driver on grade crossing elimination work,
at Bay Street and Vanderbilt Avenue.
May 1, 1931
P. L. Sperr

728554f-a.text:
Bay Street, south from Vanderbilt Avenue. On the left are tracks and shops of the Staten Island Railroad. Spanning the street is a new bridge, which was constructed to eliminate a street-level
railroad crossing at Edgewater Street.
June 28, 1934
P. L. Sperr
